resources.description: List of related artifacts involved in the event

type.description: Type of the webhook event triggered by Harbor. See Harbor documentation for details.

artifact_revision_ids.description: List of artifact revision IDs to cleanup.
artifact_revision_ids.title: Artifact Revision Ids

artifact_revision_id.description: The artifact revision ID to cancel import.
artifact_revision_id.title: Artifact Revision Id

force.description: Force re-download regardless of digest freshness check.

artifact_revision_ids.description: List of artifact revision IDs to import.
artifact_revision_ids.title: Artifact Revision Ids

vfolder_id.description: Optional vfolder ID to import artifacts directly into.
vfolder_id.title: Vfolder Id

options.description: Options controlling import behavior such as forcing re-download.

readonly.description: Whether the artifact should be readonly.
readonly.title: Readonly

registry_id.description: The unique identifier of the artifact registry to scan.
registry_id.title: Registry Id

limit.description: Maximum number of artifacts to scan (max: 500)
limit.title: Limit

delegator_reservoir_id.description: ID of the reservoir registry to delegate the scan request to

delegatee_target.description: The unique identifier of the target reservoir to delegate the scan.

limit.description: Maximum number of artifacts to scan (max: 500)

artifact_revision_ids.description: List of artifact revision IDs to delegate the import request.
artifact_revision_ids.title: Artifact Revision Ids

delegator_reservoir_id.description: ID of the reservoir registry to delegate the import request to
delegator_reservoir_id.title: Delegator Reservoir Id

options.description: Options controlling import behavior such as forcing re-download.

model_id.description:
HuggingFace model ID to import.
        The model will be downloaded from HuggingFace Hub and stored in the specified storage.
model_id.title: Model Id

revision.description:
Specific revision (branch or tag) of the model to import.
        Defaults to 'main' if not specified.
revision.title: Revision

models.description: List of models to scan from the registry.
models.title: Models

registry_id.description: The unique identifier of the artifact registry to scan.
registry_id.title: Registry Id

VFolderMountPermission.description:
Permissions for a virtual folder given to a specific access key.
RW_DELETE includes READ_WRITE and READ_WRITE includes READ_ONLY.
VFolderMountPermission.title: VFolderMountPermission

VFolderUsageMode.description:
Usage mode of virtual folder.

GENERAL: normal virtual folder
MODEL: virtual folder which provides shared models
DATA: virtual folder which provides shared data
VFolderUsageMode.title: VFolderUsageMode

vfolderId.description: Target vfolder id to soft-delete, to go to trash bin
vfolderId.title: Vfolderid

id.description: Target vfolder id to purge, permanently remove from DB
id.title: Id

id.description: Target vfolder id to hard-delete, permanently remove from storage
id.title: Id

user.description: Target user id to update sharing status.
user.title: User

permission.description: Permission to update. Delete the sharing between vfolder and user if this value is null. Should be one of ['ro', 'rw', 'wd']. Default value is null.

vfolder.description: Target vfolder id to update sharing status.
vfolder.title: Vfolder

user_perm.description: A list of user and permission mappings.
user_perm.title: User Perm

id.description: Unique ID referencing the model service.
id.title: Id

active_route_count.description: Information of routes which are actually spawned and ready to accept the traffic.
active_route_count.title: Active Route Count

service_endpoint.description: HTTP(S) endpoint to the API service. This field will be filed after the attempt to create a first inference session succeeds. Endpoint created is fixed and immutable for the bound endpoint until the endpoint is destroyed.
service_endpoint.title: Service Endpoint

is_public.description: Indicates if the API endpoint is open to public. In this context "public" means there will be no authentication required to communicate with this API service.
is_public.title: Is Public

model.description: Name or ID of the model VFolder
model.title: Model

model_definition_path.description: Path to the model definition file. If not set, Backend.AI will look for model-definition.yml or model-definition.yaml by default.
model_definition_path.title: Model Definition Path

modelMountDestination.description: Mount destination for the model VFolder will be mounted inside the inference session. Must be set to `/models` when choosing `runtime_variant` other than `CUSTOM` or `CMD`.
modelMountDestination.title: Modelmountdestination

extra_mounts.description: Specifications about extra VFolders mounted to model service session. MODEL type VFolders are not allowed to be attached to model service session with this option.
extra_mounts.title: Extra Mounts

environ.description: Environment variables to be set inside the inference session
environ.title: Environ

scalingGroup.description: Name of the resource group to spawn inference sessions
scalingGroup.title: Scalinggroup

desired_session_count.description: Number of sessions to serve traffic. Replacement of `desired_session_count` (or `desiredSessionCount`).
desired_session_count.title: Desired Session Count

lang.description: String reference of the image which will be used to create session
lang.title: Lang

runtime_variant.description: Type of the inference runtime the image will try to load.

arch.description: Changed to nullable in 26.1. Image architecture. If not provided, defaults to the Manager's architecture.
arch.title: Arch

group.description: Name of project to spawn session
group.title: Group

domain.description: Name of domain to spawn session
domain.title: Domain

owner_access_key.description: (for privileged users only) when specified, transfer ownership of the inference session to specified user
owner_access_key.title: Owner Access Key

open_to_public.description: If set to true, do not require an API key to access the model service
open_to_public.title: Open To Public

route_id.description: Unique ID referencing endpoint route. Each endpoint route has a one-to-one relationship with the inference session.
route_id.title: Route Id

session_id.description: Unique ID referencing the inference session.
session_id.title: Session Id

endpoint_id.description: Unique ID referencing the model service.
endpoint_id.title: Endpoint Id

extra_mounts.description: List of extra VFolders which will be mounted to model service session.
extra_mounts.title: Extra Mounts

model_definition_path.description: Path to the the model definition file. If not set, Backend.AI will look for model-definition.yml or model-definition.yaml by default.
model_definition_path.title: Model Definition Path

active_routes.description: Information of routes which are bound with healthy sessions.
active_routes.title: Active Routes

service_endpoint.description: HTTP(S) endpoint to the API service. This field will be filed after the attempt to create a first inference session succeeds. Endpoint created is fixed and immutable for the bound endpoint until the endpoint is destroyed.
service_endpoint.title: Service Endpoint

is_public.description: Indicates if the API endpoint is open to public. In this context "public" means there will be no authentication required to communicate with this API service.
is_public.title: Is Public

runtime_variant.description: Type of the inference runtime the image will try to load.

name.description: Identifier to be passed later inside request body
name.title: Name

human_readable_name.description: Use this value as displayed label to user
human_readable_name.title: Human Readable Name

duration.description: The lifetime duration of the token.
duration.title: Duration

valid_until.description: The absolute token expiry date expressed in the Unix epoch format.
valid_until.title: Valid Until

expires_at.description: The expiration timestamp computed from duration or valid_until.
expires_at.title: Expires At

session_ids.description: ID array of sessions to check and transit status.
session_ids.title: Session Ids

kernelId.description: Target kernel to get container logs.
kernelId.title: Kernelid

image_name.description: Name of the image to be created.
image_name.title: Image Name

image_visibility.description: Visibility scope of newly created image. currently only supports `USER` scope. Setting this to value other than `USER` will raise error.

artifact_revision_id.title: Artifact Revision Id

RouteTrafficStatus.description:
Traffic routing status for a route.

Controls whether traffic should be sent to this route.
Actual traffic delivery depends on RouteStatus being HEALTHY.

- ACTIVE: Traffic enabled (will receive traffic when RouteStatus is HEALTHY)
- INACTIVE: Traffic disabled (will not receive traffic regardless of RouteStatus)

DateRangeFilter.description:
Filters records by a date range.

Both boundaries are inclusive. You can specify just 'after', just 'before',
or both to define the range. Records matching the boundary values are included.
This filter is used for date fields like period_start in usage buckets.

after.description: Include only records with dates on or after this date. Should be in ISO 8601 date format (e.g., '2024-01-01'). If not specified, there is no lower bound on the date range.
after.title: After

before.description: Include only records with dates on or before this date. Should be in ISO 8601 date format (e.g., '2024-12-31'). If not specified, there is no upper bound on the date range.
before.title: Before

DateRangeFilter.title: DateRangeFilter

ResourceWeightEntryInput.description:
A single resource weight entry for fair share calculation.

Set weight to null to remove the resource type weight (revert to default).

resource_type.description: Resource type identifier (e.g., cpu, mem, cuda.shares)
resource_type.title: Resource Type

weight.description: Weight multiplier for this resource type. Set to null to remove (revert to default weight).
weight.title: Weight

ResourceWeightEntryInput.title: ResourceWeightEntryInput

UpdateResourceGroupFairShareSpecRequest.description:
Request body for updating resource group fair share spec (partial update).

All fields are optional. Only provided fields are updated; others retain existing values.

half_life_days.description: Half-life for exponential decay in days. Leave null to keep existing value.
half_life_days.title: Half Life Days

lookback_days.description: Total lookback period in days. Leave null to keep existing value.
lookback_days.title: Lookback Days

decay_unit_days.description: Granularity of decay buckets in days. Leave null to keep existing value.
decay_unit_days.title: Decay Unit Days

default_weight.description: Default weight for entities. Leave null to keep existing value.
default_weight.title: Default Weight

resource_weights.description: Resource weights for fair share calculation. Each entry specifies a resource type and its weight multiplier. Only provided resource types are updated (partial update). Set weight to null to remove that resource type (revert to default). Leave the entire list null to keep all existing values.
resource_weights.title: Resource Weights

UpdateResourceGroupFairShareSpecRequest.title: UpdateResourceGroupFairShareSpecRequest

DateTimeRangeFilter.description:
Filters records by a datetime range.

Both boundaries are inclusive. You can specify just 'after', just 'before',
or both to define the range. Records matching the boundary values are included.
This filter is shared across all report types for datetime fields like
created_at, modified_at, terminated_at, etc.

after.description: Include only records created on or after this datetime. Should be in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2024-01-01T00:00:00Z'). If not specified, there is no lower bound on the datetime range.
after.title: After

before.description: Include only records created on or before this datetime. Should be in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2024-12-31T23:59:59Z'). If not specified, there is no upper bound on the datetime range.
before.title: Before

DateTimeRangeFilter.title: DateTimeRangeFilter

UserExportFilter.description:
Filter conditions specific to user export.

All specified conditions are combined with AND logic.
Only records matching all specified filters will be exported.
Use this to narrow down the exported user data to specific criteria.

username.description: Filter users by username. Supports various match modes: contains, equals, starts_with, ends_with. Can be case-insensitive and/or negated.

email.description: Filter users by email address. Supports various match modes: contains, equals, starts_with, ends_with. Useful for finding users from specific email domains.

domain_name.description: Filter users by their assigned domain name. Use this to export users belonging to a specific domain.

role.description: Filter users by role(s). Accepts a list of role values (e.g., ['admin', 'user', 'monitor']). Uses IN query.
role.title: Role

status.description: Filter users by account status(es). Accepts a list of status values (e.g., ['active', 'inactive']). Uses IN query.
status.title: Status

created_at.description: Filter users by their registration timestamp. Specify 'after' and/or 'before' to define the datetime range. Useful for exporting users registered within a specific period.

UserExportFilter.title: UserExportFilter

UserExportOrder.description:
Specifies how to sort the exported user data.

Multiple UserExportOrder instances can be provided to define multi-level sorting.
The order in the list determines priority (first item is primary sort key).

field.description: The field to sort by. Must be one of the valid user orderable fields: username, email, full_name, domain_name, role, status, created_at, modified_at.

direction.description: Sort direction. 'asc' for ascending (A-Z, oldest-first), 'desc' for descending (Z-A, newest-first). Default is 'asc'.

UserExportOrder.title: UserExportOrder

UserExportOrderField.description:
Orderable fields for user export.

These are the fields that can be used for sorting user export results.
Not all user fields are sortable - only commonly used sort keys are included.
UserExportOrderField.title: UserExportOrderField

UserExportCSVRequest.description:
Request body for user CSV export operations.

This is the request model for POST /export/users/csv endpoint.
All parameters are optional to allow flexible export configurations.

fields.description: List of field keys to include in the export. Available fields: uuid, username, email, full_name, domain_name, role, status, created_at, modified_at. If not specified or empty, all available fields will be exported.
fields.title: Fields

filter.description: Filter conditions to apply before export. Only users matching all specified conditions will be included. If not specified, all users (up to max_rows limit) will be exported.

order.description: List of ordering specifications for sorting the exported data. Multiple orders can be specified for multi-level sorting. The first item in the list is the primary sort key.
order.title: Order

encoding.description: Character encoding for the CSV output. Supported values: 'utf-8' (default, recommended for most uses), 'euc-kr' (for Korean systems requiring legacy encoding).
encoding.title: Encoding

UserExportCSVRequest.title: UserExportCSVRequest

SessionExportFilter.description:
Filter conditions specific to session export.

All specified conditions are combined with AND logic.
Only records matching all specified filters will be exported.
Use this to narrow down the exported session data to specific criteria.

name.description: Filter sessions by name. Supports various match modes: contains, equals, starts_with, ends_with. Can be case-insensitive and/or negated.

session_type.description: Filter sessions by type(s). Accepts a list of type values (e.g., ['interactive', 'batch', 'inference']). Uses IN query.
session_type.title: Session Type

domain_name.description: Filter sessions by domain name. Use this to export sessions belonging to a specific domain.

access_key.description: Filter sessions by the owning access key. Use this to export sessions created by a specific user/keypair.

status.description: Filter sessions by status(es). Accepts a list of status values (e.g., ['PENDING', 'RUNNING', 'TERMINATED']). Uses IN query.
status.title: Status

scaling_group_name.description: Filter sessions by scaling group name. Use this to export sessions running on specific resource pools.

created_at.description: Filter sessions by creation timestamp. Specify 'after' and/or 'before' to define the datetime range. Useful for exporting sessions created within a specific period.

terminated_at.description: Filter sessions by termination timestamp. Specify 'after' and/or 'before' to define the datetime range. Useful for exporting sessions that ended within a specific period. Note: Only terminated sessions have this field populated.

SessionExportFilter.title: SessionExportFilter

SessionExportOrder.description:
Specifies how to sort the exported session data.

Multiple SessionExportOrder instances can be provided to define multi-level sorting.
The order in the list determines priority (first item is primary sort key).

field.description: The field to sort by. Must be one of the valid session orderable fields: name, session_type, domain_name, access_key, status, scaling_group_name, cluster_size, created_at, terminated_at.

direction.description: Sort direction. 'asc' for ascending (A-Z, oldest-first), 'desc' for descending (Z-A, newest-first). Default is 'asc'.

SessionExportOrder.title: SessionExportOrder

SessionExportOrderField.description:
Orderable fields for session export.

These are the fields that can be used for sorting session export results.
Includes both creation and termination timestamps for flexible time-based ordering.
SessionExportOrderField.title: SessionExportOrderField

SessionExportCSVRequest.description:
Request body for session CSV export operations.

This is the request model for POST /export/sessions/csv endpoint.
All parameters are optional to allow flexible export configurations.

fields.description: List of field keys to include in the export. Available fields: id, name, session_type, domain_name, access_key, status, status_info, scaling_group_name, cluster_size, occupying_slots, created_at, terminated_at. If not specified or empty, all available fields will be exported.
fields.title: Fields

filter.description: Filter conditions to apply before export. Only sessions matching all specified conditions will be included. If not specified, all sessions (up to max_rows limit) will be exported.

order.description: List of ordering specifications for sorting the exported data. Multiple orders can be specified for multi-level sorting. The first item in the list is the primary sort key.
order.title: Order

encoding.description: Character encoding for the CSV output. Supported values: 'utf-8' (default, recommended for most uses), 'euc-kr' (for Korean systems requiring legacy encoding).
encoding.title: Encoding

SessionExportCSVRequest.title: SessionExportCSVRequest

BooleanFilter.description:
Filter for boolean fields.

Simple filter that matches records where the field equals the specified value.

equals.description: The boolean value to match. Set to true to include only records where the field is true, or false to include only records where the field is false.
equals.title: Equals

BooleanFilter.title: BooleanFilter

ProjectExportFilter.description:
Filter conditions specific to project export.

All specified conditions are combined with AND logic.
Only records matching all specified filters will be exported.
Use this to narrow down the exported project data to specific criteria.

Only base project fields are supported for filtering.

name.description: Filter projects by name. Supports various match modes: contains, equals, starts_with, ends_with. Can be case-insensitive and/or negated.

domain_name.description: Filter projects by domain name. Use this to export projects belonging to a specific domain.

is_active.description: Filter projects by active status. Set equals to true for active projects only, or false for inactive/archived projects only.

created_at.description: Filter projects by creation timestamp. Specify 'after' and/or 'before' to define the datetime range. Useful for exporting projects created within a specific period.

ProjectExportFilter.title: ProjectExportFilter

ProjectExportOrder.description:
Specifies how to sort the exported project data.

Multiple ProjectExportOrder instances can be provided to define multi-level sorting.
The order in the list determines priority (first item is primary sort key).

field.description: The field to sort by. Only base project fields are supported: name, domain_name, is_active, created_at, modified_at. JOIN fields (resource_policy, scaling_group, container_registry) are not orderable.

direction.description: Sort direction. 'asc' for ascending (A-Z, oldest-first, false-first), 'desc' for descending (Z-A, newest-first, true-first). Default is 'asc'.

ProjectExportOrder.title: ProjectExportOrder

ProjectExportOrderField.description:
Orderable fields for project export.

These are the fields that can be used for sorting project export results.
Only base project fields are supported for ordering.
ProjectExportOrderField.title: ProjectExportOrderField

ProjectExportCSVRequest.description:
Request body for project CSV export operations.

This is the request model for POST /export/projects/csv endpoint.
All parameters are optional to allow flexible export configurations.

fields.description: List of field keys to include in the export. Available fields: id, name, description, domain_name, is_active, total_resource_slots, created_at, modified_at. If not specified or empty, all available fields will be exported.
fields.title: Fields

filter.description: Filter conditions to apply before export. Only projects matching all specified conditions will be included. If not specified, all projects (up to max_rows limit) will be exported.

order.description: List of ordering specifications for sorting the exported data. Multiple orders can be specified for multi-level sorting. The first item in the list is the primary sort key.
order.title: Order

encoding.description: Character encoding for the CSV output. Supported values: 'utf-8' (default, recommended for most uses), 'euc-kr' (for Korean systems requiring legacy encoding).
encoding.title: Encoding

ProjectExportCSVRequest.title: ProjectExportCSVRequest

KeypairExportCSVRequest.description:
Request body for keypair CSV export operations.

This is the request model for POST /export/keypairs/csv endpoint.
Note: Filtering and ordering are not yet supported for keypair exports.

fields.description: List of field keys to include in the export. Available basic fields: access_key, user_id, user_uuid, is_active, is_admin, created_at, modified_at, last_used, resource_policy_name. Available JOIN fields: user_*, resource_policy_*, resource_group_*, session_*. If not specified or empty, all available fields will be exported.
fields.title: Fields

encoding.description: Character encoding for the CSV output. Supported values: 'utf-8' (default, recommended for most uses), 'euc-kr' (for Korean systems requiring legacy encoding).
encoding.title: Encoding

KeypairExportCSVRequest.title: KeypairExportCSVRequest

AuditLogExportFilter.description:
Filter conditions specific to audit log export.

All specified conditions are combined with AND logic.
Only records matching all specified filters will be exported.
Use this to narrow down the exported audit log data to specific criteria.

entity_type.description: Filter audit logs by entity type (e.g., 'session', 'user', 'keypair'). Use exact match (equals) to filter by specific entity type.

entity_id.description: Filter audit logs by entity ID. Use this to export audit logs for a specific entity.

operation.description: Filter audit logs by operation type (e.g., 'create', 'update', 'delete'). Use exact match (equals) to filter by specific operation.

status.description: Filter audit logs by status(es). Accepts a list of status values (e.g., ['success', 'failure']). Uses IN query.
status.title: Status

triggered_by.description: Filter audit logs by the user or system that triggered the action. Use this to export audit logs initiated by a specific actor.

request_id.description: Filter audit logs by request ID. Use this to export audit logs for a specific API request.

created_at.description: Filter audit logs by creation timestamp. Specify 'after' and/or 'before' to define the datetime range. Useful for exporting audit logs within a specific period.

AuditLogExportFilter.title: AuditLogExportFilter

AuditLogExportOrder.description:
Specifies how to sort the exported audit log data.

Multiple AuditLogExportOrder instances can be provided to define multi-level sorting.
The order in the list determines priority (first item is primary sort key).

field.description: The field to sort by. Must be one of the valid audit log orderable fields: entity_type, entity_id, operation, status, created_at, triggered_by.

direction.description: Sort direction. 'asc' for ascending (A-Z, oldest-first), 'desc' for descending (Z-A, newest-first). Default is 'asc'.

AuditLogExportOrder.title: AuditLogExportOrder

AuditLogExportOrderField.description:
Orderable fields for audit log export.

These are the fields that can be used for sorting audit log export results.
AuditLogExportOrderField.title: AuditLogExportOrderField

AuditLogExportCSVRequest.description:
Request body for audit log CSV export operations.

This is the request model for POST /export/audit-logs/csv endpoint.
All parameters are optional to allow flexible export configurations.

fields.description: List of field keys to include in the export. Available fields: id, action_id, entity_type, entity_id, operation, status, created_at, description, request_id, triggered_by, duration. If not specified or empty, all available fields will be exported.
fields.title: Fields

filter.description: Filter conditions to apply before export. Only audit logs matching all specified conditions will be included. If not specified, all audit logs (up to max_rows limit) will be exported.

order.description: List of ordering specifications for sorting the exported data. Multiple orders can be specified for multi-level sorting. The first item in the list is the primary sort key.
order.title: Order

encoding.description: Character encoding for the CSV output. Supported values: 'utf-8' (default, recommended for most uses), 'euc-kr' (for Korean systems requiring legacy encoding).
encoding.title: Encoding

AuditLogExportCSVRequest.title: AuditLogExportCSVRequest

get.description:
**Preconditions:**
* User privilege required.
* Manager status required: RUNNING

patch.description:
**Preconditions:**
* Superadmin privilege required.
* Manager status required: one of FROZEN, RUNNING

post.description:
**Preconditions:**
* Manager status required: RUNNING

Clean up stored artifact revision data to free storage space.

Removes the downloaded files for the specified artifact revisions and
transitions them back to SCANNED status. The metadata remains, allowing
the artifacts to be re-imported later if needed.

Use this operation to manage storage usage by removing unused artifacts.


**Preconditions:**
* User privilege required.

Approve an artifact revision for general use.

Admin-only operation to approve artifact revisions, typically used
in environments with approval workflows for artifact deployment.


**Preconditions:**
* User privilege required.

Reject an artifact revision, preventing its use.

Admin-only operation to reject artifact revisions, typically used
in environments with approval workflows for artifact deployment.


**Preconditions:**
* User privilege required.

Cancel an in-progress artifact import operation.

Stops the download process for the specified artifact revision and
reverts its status back to SCANNED. The partially downloaded data is cleaned up.


**Preconditions:**
* User privilege required.

Import scanned artifact revisions from external registries.

Downloads the actual files for the specified artifact revisions, transitioning
them from SCANNED  PULLING  PULLED  AVAILABLE status.

Returns background tasks that can be monitored for import progress.
Once AVAILABLE, artifacts can be used by users in their sessions.


**Preconditions:**
* User privilege required.

patch.description:
Update artifact metadata properties.

Modifies artifact metadata such as readonly status and description.
This operation does not affect the actual artifact files or revisions.


**Preconditions:**
* User privilege required.

get.description:
Retrieve the README content for a specific artifact revision.

Returns the README documentation associated with the artifact revision,
which typically contains usage instructions and model information.


**Preconditions:**
* User privilege required.

Retrieve the verification result for a specific artifact revision.

Returns the verification result data associated with the artifact revision,
which contains results from all verifiers that have been run on the artifact.


**Preconditions:**
* User privilege required.

Retrieve download progress for an artifact revision.

Returns detailed download progress information including artifact-level
and file-level progress data for the specified artifact revision.
Supports both local and remote download progress when delegation is enabled.


**Preconditions:**
* User privilege required.

post.description:
Scan external registries to discover available artifacts.

Searches HuggingFace or Reservoir registries for artifacts matching the specified
criteria and registers them in the system with SCANNED status. The artifacts
become available for import but are not downloaded until explicitly imported.

This is the first step in the artifact workflow: Scan  Import  Use.


**Preconditions:**
* User privilege required.

**Preconditions:**
* User privilege required.

**Preconditions:**
* User privilege required.

Search registered artifacts with cursor-based pagination.

Returns artifacts that have been previously scanned and registered in the system.
Supports efficient pagination for browsing through large datasets of artifacts
with their revision information.


**Preconditions:**
* User privilege required.

schema.description: The model revision to scan from the registry.
schema.title: Revision

schema.description: The unique identifier of the artifact registry to scan.
schema.title: Registry Id

get.description:
Scan a single model and retrieve detailed information immediately.

Performs immediate detailed scanning of a specified model including
README content and file sizes. This provides complete metadata
for the model, ready for import or direct use.


**Preconditions:**
* User privilege required.

post.description:
Perform batch scanning of specific models from external registries.

Scans multiple specified models and retrieves detailed information.
The README content and file sizes are processed in the background,
unlike single model scanning which retrieves this information immediately.


**Preconditions:**
* User privilege required.

get.description:
Returns the list of all registered docker registries.


**Preconditions:**
* Superadmin privilege required.

post.description:
A raw access API to read key-value pairs from the etcd.

.. warning::

   When reading the keys with ``prefix=True``, it uses a simple string-prefix
   matching over the flattened keys (with the delimiter "/").  Thus, it may
   return additional keys that you may not want.

   For example, reading "some/key1" will fetch all of the following keys:

   .. code-block:: text

       some/key1
       some/key1/field1
       some/key1/field2
       some/key12
       some/key12/field1
       some/key12/field2

   **To avoid this issue, developers must use dedicated CRUD APIs
   instead of relying on the etcd raw access APIs whenever possible.**


**Preconditions:**
* Superadmin privilege required.

A raw access API to write key-value pairs into the etcd.


**Preconditions:**
* Superadmin privilege required.

A raw access API to delete key-value pairs from the etcd.

.. warning::

   When deleting the keys with ``prefix=True``, it uses a simple string-prefix
   matching over the flattened keys (with the delimiter "/"). This may result in
   unexpected deletion of sibling keys.

   For example, deleting "some/key1" will DELETE all of the following keys:

   .. code-block:: text

       some/key1
       some/key1/field1
       some/key1/field2
       some/key12
       some/key12/field1
       some/key12/field2

   **To avoid this issue, developers must use dedicated CRUD APIs
   instead of relying on the etcd raw access APIs whenever possible.**


**Preconditions:**
* Superadmin privilege required.

get.description:
Return the contents of `/etc/fstab` file.


**Preconditions:**
* Superadmin privilege required.
* Manager status required: one of FROZEN, RUNNING

List all mounted vfolder hosts in vfroot.

All mounted hosts from connected (ALIVE) agents are also gathered.
Generally, agents should be configured to have same hosts structure,
but newly introduced one may not.


**Preconditions:**
* Superadmin privilege required.
* Manager status required: one of FROZEN, RUNNING

post.description:
Mount device into vfolder host.

Mount a device (eg: nfs) located at `fs_location` into `<vfroot>/name` in the
host machines (manager and all agents). `fs_type` can be specified by requester,
which fallbaks to 'nfs'.

If `scaling_group` is specified, try to mount for agents in the scaling group.


**Preconditions:**
* Superadmin privilege required.
* Manager status required: RUNNING

delete.description:
Unmount device from vfolder host.

Unmount a device (eg: nfs) located at `<vfroot>/name` from the host machines
(manager and all agents).

If `scaling_group` is specified, try to unmount for agents in the scaling group.


**Preconditions:**
* Superadmin privilege required.
* Manager status required: RUNNING

post.description:
Unmount device from vfolder host.

Unmount a device (eg: nfs) located at `<vfroot>/name` from the host machines
(manager and all agents).

If `scaling_group` is specified, try to unmount for agents in the scaling group.


**Preconditions:**
* Superadmin privilege required.
* Manager status required: RUNNING

Change the ownership of vfolder
For now, we only provide changing the ownership of user-folder


**Preconditions:**
* Superadmin privilege required.
* Manager status required: RUNNING

Returns the list of all resource presets in the current scaling group,
with additional information including allocatability of each preset,
amount of total remaining resources, and the current keypair resource limits.


**Preconditions:**
* User privilege required.
* Manager status required: one of FROZEN, RUNNING

Update `keypair_resource_usages` in redis and `agents.c.occupied_slots`.

Those two values are sometimes out of sync. In that case, calling this API
re-calculates the values for running containers and updates them in DB.


**Preconditions:**
* Superadmin privilege required.
* Manager status required: one of FROZEN, RUNNING

schema.description: List of items separated by a delimiter (default: comma). Items may contain spaces, but not the delimiter.

get.description:
Return usage statistics of terminated containers for a specified month.
The date/time comparison is done using the configured timezone.

:param group_ids: If not None, query containers only in those groups.
:param month: The year-month to query usage statistics. ex) "202006" to query for Jun 2020


**Preconditions:**
* Superadmin privilege required.
* Manager status required: one of FROZEN, RUNNING

Return usage statistics of terminated containers belonged to the given group for a specified
period in dates.
The date/time comparison is done using the configured timezone.

:param project_id: If not None, query containers only in the project.
:param start_date str: "yyyymmdd" format.
:param end_date str: "yyyymmdd" format.


**Preconditions:**
* Superadmin privilege required.
* Manager status required: one of FROZEN, RUNNING

Return time-binned (15 min) stats for terminated user sessions
over last 30 days.


**Preconditions:**
* User privilege required.
* Manager status required: one of FROZEN, RUNNING

Generate a presigned URL for uploading artifact files.

Creates a time-limited, secure URL that allows direct upload of files
to object storage without exposing storage credentials. Includes
additional form fields required for the upload operation.


**Preconditions:**
* User privilege required.

Generate a presigned URL for safely downloading artifact files.

Creates a time-limited, secure URL that allows direct download of specific
artifact files from object storage without exposing storage credentials.
Used to provide secure access to AVAILABLE artifact files.


**Preconditions:**
* User privilege required.

get.description:
Retrieve all storage namespaces (buckets) across all storage systems.

Returns a mapping of storage systems to their available namespaces.
This provides an overview of all available storage compartments
where artifacts can be stored.

Note: This API is deprecated. Use /storage-namespaces instead.


**Preconditions:**
* User privilege required.

Retrieve storage namespaces (buckets) for a specific storage system.

Returns the list of available namespaces within the specified storage
system where artifacts can be organized and stored.

Note: This API is deprecated. Use /storage-namespaces instead.


**Preconditions:**
* User privilege required.

List all configured object storage systems.

Returns information about all available storage systems that can be
used for storing artifacts, including their configuration and capabilities.


**Preconditions:**
* User privilege required.

post.description:
Download artifact directory from VFS storage via storage proxy streaming.

Args:
    path: Path parameters including storage name
    body: Request body with file path

Returns:
    APIStreamResponse with StreamReader body


**Preconditions:**
* User privilege required.

get.description:
List files recursively in a VFS storage directory via storage proxy.

Args:
    path: Path parameters including storage name
    body: Request body with directory path

Returns:
    APIResponse with list of files


**Preconditions:**
* User privilege required.

Get VFS storage information by storage name.

Args:
    path: Path parameters including storage name

Returns:
    APIResponse with storage information


**Preconditions:**
* User privilege required.

List all VFS storages.

Returns:
    APIResponse with storage information


**Preconditions:**
* User privilege required.
